minus continuation stealing, I guess. (Working with OpenCilk team makes me want continuation stealing so badly...)

text: Oh, googling "thread migration" gave some hits on facial reconstruction surgery so.... yeah beware.

text: got any decent papers on it <@U67BJLYCS>?

elements.text: got any decent papers on it

text: Ah, I used thread migration as a shorthand. I. The literature you should find it as task migration. Right now in Julia the worker thread that starts executing a task will always keep executing that task. Now imagine you have a couple of long running tasks and all of them executing on thread 1

elements.text: Ah, I used thread migration as a shorthand. I. The literature you should find it as task migration. Right now in Julia the worker thread that starts executing a task will always keep executing that task. Now imagine you have a couple of long running tasks and all of them executing on thread 1

text: Even though thread 2 is idle it can't currently steal work that already was scheduled and executed once from thread 1

elements.text: Even though thread 2 is idle it can't currently steal work that already was scheduled and executed once from thread 1
